post.summary: Executes several queries into a single batch command
post.description:
Allows to get in a single call several requests executed on the server.
Can be very useful when many information from different entities need to be collected at a time.
For example retrieve detailed information of all the assets of a single zone in one shot.

requestBody.description: Object containing the list of requests to perform and the query options that can be applied (useTransaction, stopAtFirstError).

200.description: List of result code and result content of each query from the batch

post.summary: Authenticate a user of the openBOS using the local edge access point (does not apply for cloud authentication)
post.description:
openBOS offers a secure authentication using Json Web Token (JWT) workflow.
This resource path authenticates an API user and retrieves a valid token to be set inside Authorization header for further API calls
Header format as follows Authorization: Bearer "jwt"
Token duration is 30 minutes

200.description: Authentication result including the JWT to be used for further calls

patch.summary: Configure the initial password on the edge
patch.description: Changes the password of the first default user. Used only once at project's initialization.

200.description: Indicates the initial password has been correctly set

post.description: Logout the user from its token, will correposnding user activity entry and will devalidate current notification subscribed by the user.

post.summary: Refresh the access token (Json Web Token) for further API calls
post.description:
Used to generate a new JWT (Json Web Token) on basis of the one retrieved by /api/v1/ontology/authentication.
It allows to refresh communication token without having to pass original login/password

200.description: Authentication result including the JWT to be used for further calls

get.summary: Returns users of a certain type for a certain property zone
get.description:
This resource path retrieves the basics information of users matching a criteria.
openBOS offers several type of users and you may have differences in roles, agreements, … between these types of users.
We are managing: Tenant, Owner, PropertyManager, FacilityManager, Visitor and Administrator. Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right to retrieve more users than himself.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of requested users

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Id of the parent property zone

200.description: List of basics information of users matching the criteria.

get.summary: Get detail of a specific user
get.description:
This resource path retrieves detailed information of a user identified by its unique identifier
openBOS offers several type of users having different roles, agreements, … between these types of users. Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right and same root role as the requested user to use this method on a user different than himself.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user

200.description: Retrieve detailed information of found users.

get.summary: Get all available access rights
get.description:
This resource path retrieves the list of access right that can be set to a role in an openBOS project
openBOS uses a role base access control system.
Each user being linked to role, each role having permissions.
The access rights are one of these possible permissions authorized for a role.

get.summary: Get lockout duration for a given locked out user
get.description: If too many consecutive login failures the end-user is lockout a certain ammount of time. This resource path retrieves the time to wait before being authorized to make a new attempt.

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user

200.description: The duration in ms that needs to wait the user to log in again

get.summary: Get the list of the jobmasks in the project.
get.description:
This resource path retrieves the list of jobmasks inside the project.
Users have jobmasks meaning a family of users they belong. Objects may or may not be available depending on jobmasks parameters.
For example with a jobmask Electrical Installer you may not access to the HVAC components.
Jobmasks descriptions are defined by administrator in openBOS.
For more information on the jobmask use the resource path jobmask with the ID of the jobMask

get.summary: Get detailled information on a specific jobmask
get.description:
This resource path retrieves detailled information on a specific jobmask.
Users have jobmasks meaning a family of users they belong. Objects may or may not be available depending on jobmasks parameters.
For example with a jobmask Electrical Installer you may not access to the HVAC components.
Jobmasks descriptions are defined by administrator in openBOS.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the jobmask

200.description: The detailled information of the jobmask

get.summary: Get the project settings
get.description:
Get the project settings of openBOS
Settings include name, details, language, supported languages, device synchronisation status, interval of synchronization with Cloud, …

Settings include name, details, language, supported languages, device synchronisation status, interval of synchronization with Cloud, …

get.summary: Get the roles available in the project
get.description: This resource path retrieves the list of roles a user can be assigned to. openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all roles will be returned. Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

200.description: List of roles matching the filter criteria.

get.summary: Get a specific role
get.description: This resource path retrieves a specific role by its unique identifier. openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the requested role

This resource path retrieves the basics information of station defined in the project.

Detailled information on a station can be found by using station resource path including its unique id (ie: .../station/{id} )

get.summary: Get detailled information for a specific station

A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
That resource path returns the detailled information of a specific station in the project.

post.summary: Forces an operation of synchronization on a specific station
post.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
That routes forces an operation of synchronization on a specific station.

200.description: Retrieves the unique identifier of the operation (tag). This tag must be passed, later on, to the synchronization status resource path to get the advancement of the operation.

get.summary: Get the status of synchronization of the stations inside the project
get.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Synchronization can be set manual or automatic for each station.
That routes retrieves the synchronization status for all the stations of the project.

200.description: Retrieves synchronization status of middleware stations

get.summary: Get the status of synchronization of a specific station.
get.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Each station can be configured to synchronize manually or automaticaly.
That routes retrieves the status of a specific forced synchronization (specified by a tag) on a specific station (specified by its id).

parameters.name: stationId
parameters.description: id of the station

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: tag returned by a forced synchronization

200.description: Retrieves a boolean indicating if the synchronization is done

get.summary: Get the synchronization "in-progress" flag for a station.
get.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Each station can be configured to synchronize manually or automaticaly.
That routes retrieves a flag indicating if a synchronization is in progress on a specific station (specified by iyts id).

parameters.name: stationId
parameters.description: id of the station

200.description: Retrieves a boolean indicating if a synchronization is in progress

get.summary: Get the database of devices and parameters of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organization.
The network organization is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
The exploration of an organization is done level by level by requesting the children.
This resource path retrieves a level in the hierarchic tree of the network organization

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: null to get the root branches, otherwise parent id of the branch to get its children

200.description: Retrieves the branches matching parentId criteria

get.summary: Get the version number of the database of devices and parameters of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organization.
This resource path retrieves the internal version of the network organization in the database (each update of the network organization increase this version number)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

get.summary: Get an item (branch) of the database of devices and parameters (temporary or not) of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the "network organization".
The network organization is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
Querying the organization is done level by level.
When updating a network organization a temporary one is created and manipulated. Once the temporary organization is comitted it will become the newest.
This resource path retrieves an item (branch) in the hierarchic tree of the network organization (temporary or not)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the branch

200.description: Retrieves the branch matching id criteria

get.summary: Get the list of available data type present in the entire project
get.description:
Each value has a datatype including unit, min, max, limit, possible value if any...
That resource path returns the catalogue of the entire datatypes available in the project depening on the transport in the edge (the protocols).
Detailled information on a datatype can be found by using the datatype resource path including its unique id (ie: .../datatype/{id} )

200.description: Retrieves the list of data type basics information

get.summary: Get the list of available data type for a given transport

A transport is a protocol. That resource path returns the list of available datatypes in a network.
You can state the network you want giving the correct protocol as a parameter
(BACnet, KNXRouting, KNXTunneling, Lonworks, ModbusSerial, ModbusIP, MBus, xDriver, Memory)

parameters.name: transport
parameters.description: The filtered transport for datatypes

200.description: Retrieves the list of data type basics information matching transport criteria

get.summary: Get the detail of a DataType of the project.
get.description:
A DataType can be of type Long, Double, Bool, String, Enumeration, Complex, DateTime, Duration, IP address, IP address + port, Byte, Array Of one of preceding dataType.
That resource path needs the ID of the datatype and returns the details
Detail of a dataType may for example gives the autorized min / max value of a Long or Double value or give the list of valid enumeration.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the data type object

parameters.name: desiredunit
parameters.description: Id of the desired unit for numeric min/max. If not present will use the unit of the datatype

200.description: Detailled information of a specific datatype.

get.summary: Get the list of available protocol driver in a specific Station
get.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): The networks.
That resource path sends back the entire protocols supported by the Station . That may be used to read data from fieldbus.
For more information on a driver use the resource path .../station/{stationId}/driver/get/{id} with the ID of the driver.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the station

200.description: List of protocol driver definitions on the station.

get.summary: Get the detail of a specific protocol driver on a station
get.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols. Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each fieldbus is accessible through a dedicated driver, this command retrieve the detail of a driver.
The driver detail contains the list of configuration values used to communicate with the fieldbus device of the protocol.
The list of configuration is dependant from the driver itself (ie: the configuration used for a ModBus communication is different from the configuration used for a BACNet communication.

parameters.name: stationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the station

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the driver

200.description: Protocol driver definitions on the station.

get.summary: Get the list of field bus networks available in the whole project.
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
A fieldbus network is a declared network of devices communicating on a protocol.
We may have for example LonWorks, BACnet, KNX, MQTT network That resource path returns the collection of available networks in a station.
For detailled on a network use the dedicated network resource path with the ID of the network (.../network/{id})

200.description: Detail information of a specific network.

Here retrieve the detailed information of an asset template by its unique identifier.
The detail will give information like possible configuration values that you will find on the asset instances that are based on the current asset template.

get.summary: Get the zone templates defined in the project
get.description:
All zones in the openBOS are based on a zone template. A zone template defines the list of functional block that can be present in the zone, as the list of datapoint that are directly present in the zone.
This resource path returns the list of zone templates available in the project.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filter criteria to limit the retrieved zone template (ie: Name contains "ABC" and Tags contains "meeting")

200.description: Basics information of matching zone templates

get.summary: Get the detail of a zone template defined in the project
get.description:
All zones in the openBOS are based on a zone template. A zone template defines the list of functional block that can be present in the zone, as the list of datapoint that are directly present in the zone.
This resource path returns detail of a specific zone template.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the requested zone template

200.description: Basics information of matching zone templates

get.summary: Get the list of trend templates in the project
get.description:
A trend template is used to create several trend instances that will have the same behaviour on a set of DataPointInstance
The selection of datapointinstance can be a manual selection of individual datapointinstance or all datapoint instances matching a datapoint template inside a zone or functional block
This resource path returns the list of trend templates that are configured within the project

200.description: Retrieves the list of trend template basics information

get.summary: Find trend templates matching an advanced criteria
get.description:
A trend template is used to create several trend instances that will have the same behaviour on a set of DataPointInstance
The selection of datapointinstance can be a manual selection of individual datapointinstance or all datapoint instances matching a datapoint template inside a zone or functional block
This resource path returns the list of templates that are matching the criteria in argument. (ie: trend template name, zone template name to which it applies)

This resource path retrieves the list of physical fieldbus devices that are defined within the property

get.description:
The devices are the equipment on the fieldbus network that are controlling actuators and sensors.

get.summary: Get the detailed information of a building

Detail information of building will contain information that will allow to traverse the hierarchy of the building.
ie: you can follow to the next structure by using the retrieved parameter "structureChildren" within the result object.

parameters.name: id

get.summary: Get the list of structures defined in the project
get.description:
A structure can be a floor, roof, facade, something that is fixed within a building.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Additional filter criteria

get.summary: Get the detail information of a specific structure of the project
get.description:
A structure can be a floor, roof, facade, something that is fixed within a building.

This resource path retrieves the detail information of a structure. The detail information contains parameters that can be used to traverse the hierarachy.
ie: parameter "spaceChildren" will contain the resource path to follow to get the list of spaces that are defined inside a specific struture.

get.summary: Get the logical areas defined in the project
get.description:
An area can be for example a central HVAC area, with its related asset + the spaces that are supplied by this central HVAC asset
It has no "physical" meaning it is a grouping of several spaces

This routes return all the areas defined in the project

parameters.description: Type of area that are filtered. Possible type of space can be found in the list of available tags in the documentation.

An area can be for example a central HVAC area, with its related asset + the spaces that are supplied by this central HVAC asset
It has no "physical" meaning it is a grouping of several spaces

get.summary: Returns the mapview definition of a structure
get.description:
The mapview is the graphical representation of a structure in 2D including its spaces and areas.

This resource path returns the mapview definition (zoom, tiles). To get the coordinates of the spaces and area you must make a subsequent call to .../mapview/{id}/graphics wher {id} is the id in the definition object returned here

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the structure for which the mapview is requested

200.description: The object definition of the mapview.

get.summary: Returns the coordinates of all the items present in the mapview
get.description:
The mapview is the graphical representation of a structure in 2D including its spaces and areas.

This resource path returns the coordinates of the spaces (MapViewElementZoneDTO), areas (MapViewElementZoneDTO), functionalblock (MapViewElementFBDTO), text (MapViewElementTextDTO), images (MapViewElementImageDTO) that have been put on the mapview.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the mapview

200.description: The object definition of mapview items and their coordinates.

Each functional block template has a tag bos:function:fb#x with x from 1 to n

Number of properties in each functional block template
Name of each property will be Property#x with x from 1 to n
Each property has a tag bos:function:property#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfDatapointsPerFB.description:
Number of datapoints in each functional block template
Name of each datapoint will be Datapoint#x with x from 1 to n
Each datapoint has a tag bos:function:datapoint#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfFunctionalBlockInstancesPerTempl.description:
Number of functional block instance for each functional block template
Name of each functional block instance will be FBT#x_FBI#y with FBT#x being name of template and y from 1 to n
Each functional block instance has a tag bos:function:fb#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfTypesOfRoom.description:
Number of type of room (zone template)
Each room zone template will be named TRoom#x with x from 1 to n
Each room template will have the tag bos:space:room:office Each room template will have the tag myroom#x with x based on the number of its template

numberOfPropertiesPerRoom.description:
Number of properties in each room zone template (note that building and floor has NO properties)
Name of each property will be Property#x with x from 1 to n
Each property has a tag bos:function:property#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfDatapointsPerRoom.description:
Number of datapoints in each room zone template (note that building and floor has NO datapoints)
Name of each datapoint will be Datapoint#x with x from 1 to n
Each datapoint has a tag bos:function:datapoint#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfRoomsPerTypeAndPerFloor.description:
Number of room (zone instance) per floor and per room type
Each room zone instance will be named TRoom#x_Room#y with TRoom#x name of template and x from 1 to n
Each room zone instance will have the tag bos:space:room:office

numberOfFunctionalBlockInstancePerRoom.description:
Number of functional block instance that are put inside each room
If there is not enough functional block instance (compare to number of rooms) then some functional block instance will belong to several room

useMemoryDPOnRooms.description: If true datapoints of room will have a random memory datapoint address with a scene that cause the datapoint to change continously

useMemoryDPOnFbs.description: If true datapoints of functional blocks will have a random memory datapoint address

memoryDPFormat.description:
Format of the memory datapoint scene.
If empty the scene will be : /scene=ana:x:y:z to build a DP with continuous changing value
Format is : /scene=ana:{periodMs}:{minValue}:{maxValue}

synchronousGeneration.description: If true generation of database will be synchronous (rest call will be blocked during execution)

numberOfBuildings.description:
Number of buildings (zone instance)
Zone template of all buildings will be named TBuilding
Zone template of the building has a tag bos:building
Each building zone instance will be named Building#x with x from 1 to n
Zone intance of the building has a tag bos:building

numberOfFloorsPerBuilding.description:
Number of floors per building
Zone template of all floors will be named TFloor
Zone template of the floor has a tag bos:structure:floor
Each floor zone instance will be named Floor#x with x from 1 to n
Zone intance of the floor has a tag bos:structure:floor
